entry.title: Regent Cinema (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Halloween-themed protest was held at the former Regent Cinema (pictured), urging the owners to "raise [it] from the dead"?

entry.title: Matthias Hanke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Matthias Hanke, an organist and choral leader by age 14, in due course became responsible for all Protestant church music in Württemberg?

entry.title: 9th Missouri Sharpshooter Battalion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the steamboat carrying the 9th Missouri Sharpshooter Battalion back from its military service sank in the Red River of the South?

entry.title: Margie Masters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Margie Masters made the cut at a golf tournament despite being shot at by a sniper on the course?

entry.title: The Faulkland Quiz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Delaware weekly newspaper The Faulkland Quiz was founded, edited and published by an 18-year-old?

entry.title: Rabab Al-Kadhimi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rabab Al-Kadhimi was threatened with deportation from Egypt due to the political nature of her poetry?

entry.title: Laflin station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Chicago "L"'s Laflin station had an elevator for caskets?

entry.title: Martin Pipe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Martin Pipe's training methods for steeplechasers were so effective, he was investigated twice for cheating?
